title: Brady touts Coleman: 'Stood on the table' for WR
content: New Bills coach Joe Brady expressed his support for wide receiver Keon Coleman, stating that "Keon Coleman is going to be a Buffalo Bill."

content: Patrick Kane passed Mike Modano on Thursday night to become the highest-scoring U.S.-born player in NHL history.

content: Seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold's oblique injury might have caused some members of the team to panic, but Darnold "hasn't flinched" through this postseason, GM John Schneider said.

title: Poch: WC ticket prices nothing to do with USMNT
content: United States coach Mauricio Pochettino said it was not his job -- nor that of his players -- to evaluate or weigh in on the price of tickets for this summer's World Cup.

title: Bills' Allen has surgery, expects quick recovery
content: Bills quarterback Josh Allen says he expects to be ready for OTAs after having foot surgery this week.

title: Record $1.76B expected to be bet on Super Bowl
content: Approximately $1.76 billion is expected to be bet on Super Bowl LX with U.S. sportsbooks, a nearly 27% year-over-year increase, according to the AGA.

title: 'Is call ko recording pe rakh': Chilling call before husband killed pregnant SWAT commando
content: A 27-year-old pregnant Delhi Police SWAT commando, Kajal Chaudhary, died after a brutal assault at her home. Her brother recounted hearing her screams during a phone call with her husband, Ankur, who allegedly confessed to the attack. The family alleges prolonged torture and dowry harassment, leading to Kajal's death.

title: Was Ajit Pawar considering an NCP merger before his death? What aides say
content: Ajit Pawar was reportedly close to merging the two NCP factions before his sudden death. His demise has created a political vacuum in Maharashtra. The future of the Nationalist Congress Party now hangs in the balance. Talks of a reunion were ongoing, but his absence complicates the process. The Pawar family faces crucial decisions regarding the party's future direction.

title: Salman Ali Agha confirms T20 WC role as Pakistan participation decision looms
content: Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha has confirmed he will bat at number three for the upcoming ICC Men's T20 World Cup, aiming to dominate spin during the Powerplay. This strategic move, already tested in a recent win against Australia, signals a clear on-field plan despite ongoing off-field uncertainties regarding the team's participation.

title: Maharashtra cabinet rejig on cards to fill Ajit Pawar's slot; Fadnavis may take charge of finance
content: A Maharashtra cabinet reshuffle is anticipated following the tragic death of Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar. With Ajit Pawar's demise, the search for a successor to his key portfolios, including finance, is underway. Speculation suggests Dilip Walse Patil and Jayant Patil are potential contenders, with a possible NCP faction merger influencing the appointments.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook gives 'clues' on what everyone wanted an update on
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook acknowledged rising memory chip prices impacting gross margins, expecting further effects this quarter.  The tech giant's purchasing teams are reportedly staying near Samsung and SK Hynix factories to secure long-term contracts for iPhone RAM.  Despite a 230% jump in memory module costs, Apple's robust services business offers a financial buffer.

title: Kolkata godown fire death toll rises to 25; skeletons, wreckage stall investigation
content: The death toll in the Nazirabad godown fire has climbed to 25 with more body parts recovered. Forensic teams are awaiting debris removal to collect crucial samples, delaying the investigation into the fire's cause. Families anxiously await identification of their loved ones through DNA tests, grappling with the devastating loss.

title: Stars dropped for indiscipline? Manpreet, Dilpreet miss India's Pro League probables
content: Veteran hockey star Manpreet Singh and two others were dropped from the FIH Pro League probables due to disciplinary issues during the South Africa tour. Sources revealed a serious incident involving a banned substance led to their exclusion. This marks a significant omission for the experienced player ahead of a crucial season.

title: I was misquoted, edited clips circulated by ‚Äòcertain IT cell‚Äô: Wangchuk to SC
content: Climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's detention under the NSA is challenged in the Supreme Court. His lawyer argues that edited videos and misquoted statements, circulated by an "IT cell," were wrongly used for his arrest. Wangchuk's wife contends he never made anti-national remarks, only criticized government policies regarding Ladakh's environmental protection and promised safeguards.

title: Microsoft loses $400 billion in hours: What triggered the stock plunge
content: Microsoft shares plummeted, wiping out over $400 billion in market value, its worst day since March 2020. Investors are concerned about the company's massive AI spending, a slowdown in its cloud segment, and OpenAI's financial stability.  Despite high demand, capacity constraints are impacting Azure's growth, leading to calls for a stock revaluation.

title: What Indian officials gifted US counterparts in 2024: Silver train set, pashmina shawl
content: US State Department records reveal gifts exchanged between Indian officials and American leaders. Prime Minister Modi presented items like a Sterling Silver Train Set valued at $7,750 to former President Biden. Other notable gifts included a Pashmina Shawl for Jill Biden and a Shiva Nataraja Bronze Statue for Lloyd Austin, with most items transferred to the National Archives.

title: Panama court ruling delivers Trump a strategic win - and a setback for Xi
content: Panama's Supreme Court has voided a major Panama Canal ports contract held by a Chinese-linked firm, a significant win for the 'Donroe Doctrine'. This ruling aligns with US efforts to curb Chinese influence over strategic trade routes, complicating Beijing's global commercial footprint and reinforcing US leverage. The decision stems from alleged irregularities, though its geopolitical implications are profound.

title: What did Elon Musk warn American companies about at Tesla‚Äôs earnings call?
content: Elon Musk issued a strong warning to American companies, urging them to invest in domestic battery manufacturing infrastructure or risk falling behind. He highlighted geopolitical risks associated with fragile supply chains for critical EV materials, emphasizing Tesla's own significant investments in lithium refining and battery production facilities in Texas to mitigate these vulnerabilities.

title: PT Usha's husband V Srinivasan passes away at 67
content: V Srinivasan, husband of IOA President P T Usha, passed away at 67 after collapsing at his Kozhikode residence. Rushed to the hospital, he could not be revived. A former central government employee, Srinivasan was a steadfast supporter of Usha's sporting and political journey. Prime Minister Narendra Modi offered his condolences to the grieving Usha and their son, Ujjwal.

title: Panic to relief: Virat Kohli‚Äôs Instagram returns after brief blackout
content: Virat Kohli's massive Instagram account, followed by over 274 million users, briefly vanished, causing widespread fan panic and speculation. The page reappeared hours later without any official explanation from Kohli, his team, or Instagram. The unexplained outage, which also affected his brother's account, has left fans seeking answers about the brief social media scare.

title: 'They won't stop imposing it': DMK's Kanimozhi flags station signboard in Hindi
content: DMK MP Kanimozhi has voiced strong opposition to the prominent use of Hindi on a Chennai railway station signboard, calling it an "imposition." This move by the BJP-led Centre reignites the long-standing language dispute between the ruling party and the Tamil Nadu government, with language politics expected to be a key factor in upcoming assembly elections.

title: Thierry Henry and Andrea Rajacic net worth, wealth and love story
content: Thierry Henry became a football legend with clubs like Arsenal and Barcelona, then stayed in the game as a coach and TV expert. By early 2026, his net worth is estimated around $125‚Äì135 million. His long-time partner Andrea Rajacic, who works in fashion, has her own income. Together, they share a quiet family life and a combin

title: MLB trade rumors: Braves eye $35M Cubs star as Robert Suarez emerges key asset
content: A hypothetical trade sees the Atlanta Braves acquiring versatile infielder Nico Hoerner from the Chicago Cubs for hard-throwing reliever Robert Suarez. This move addresses Atlanta's infield void due to injury, while Chicago secures a much-needed closer. Both players are in their prime with multi-year control, making it a balanced, win-now exchange.

title: 'I needed to let him go': Gabrielle Union on almost ending marriage with Dwyane Wade
content: Dwyane Wade and his wife, the popular actress Gabrielle Union, have had a beautiful and a healthy marriage ever since they tied the knot in 2014.While things have always been good between them, Gabrielle Union went through a traumatic struggles as she tried to conceive their baby early on in their marriage. Unfortunately, the popular actress went through a number of miscarriages and had to opt for surrogacy later. While the miscarriages affected her health, Gabrielle Union opened up how it changed her relationship with Dwyane Wade.

title: Mid-air chaos at Uttarakhand's Tehri: 2 paragliders crash into lake, SDRF beats the clock; video
content: Two paraglider pilots were dramatically rescued from Tehri Lake by the SDRF during the Acro Festival & SIV Championship. The pilots lost control and plunged into the water, but swift action by pre-deployed rescue teams ensured their safe recovery. Both are reported to be completely unharmed and have been moved to safety, with the event continuing under enhanced security.

title: From Boeing 737 examiner to ‚ÄòBunny‚Äô: The life of Baramati crash victim Capt. Sumit Kapur
content: Pilot Sumit Kapur, known as "Bunny," died in a charter aircraft crash in Maharashtra. A respected examiner with 20,000 flight hours, Kapur was remembered for his warmth and precision by family and colleagues.

title: CSK‚Äôs hand in Shivam Dube‚Äôs evolution: Nurtured as spin hitter, now thriving against pace
content: Shivam Dube's recent 65 off 23 balls in Vizag showcased his T20 World Cup potential.  His powerful hitting against spin, honed at Chennai Super Kings, is a major weapon.  While his batting has flourished, his bowling is also developing.  Team India aims to utilise both his batting and bowling skills, making him a key all-round option.

title: Rs 18,000 for 400m trip: Mumbai cab driver takes US national ‚Äòfor a ride,‚Äô arrested
content: A cab driver was arrested in Mumbai for overcharging a US national Rs 18,000 for a 400-meter ride from the airport. The incident came to light after the tourist posted about the alleged fleecing on X. Police are also searching for an accomplice involved in the scam.

title: Black carpet, $75m project, Trump by her side: Inside Melania Trump‚Äôs documentary premiere
content: A glitzy premiere in Washington celebrated the $75 million documentary 'Melania,' chronicling the former First Lady's return to the White House.  Attended by administration figures and celebrities, the film offers rare insight into Melania Trump's perspective.  Amazon and director Brett Ratner deny any political motive behind the significant investment.

title: 'Dhurandhar' OTT release censored: Fans fume over muted dialogues, 10-min cuts
content: Following its successful theatrical run, 'Dhurandhar' debuted on Netflix with a censored version, sparking fan outrage. Viewers are criticizing the streaming platform for muting dialogues, censoring abusive language, and allegedly trimming approximately 10 minutes from the film, questioning the logic of censoring an 'A' rated movie on an OTT platform.

title: ‚ÄòVery big, powerful ships sailing to Iran‚Äô: Trump issues warning to Tehran
content: US President Trump expressed a preference for diplomacy with Iran, despite bolstering US military presence in the Middle East. He reiterated demands for Tehran to abandon nuclear ambitions and cease killing protesters. Discussions reportedly include targeting Iranian leadership and fostering conditions for regime change, leveraging recent anti-government unrest.

title: Are you depressed, or just sad? Why the difference matters more than the label
content: Many people use ‚Äúdepression‚Äù as shorthand for feeling low, while others dismiss depression as ‚Äújust sadness‚Äù. Here, we explain the difference using clinicians‚Äô cues: Trigger, duration, functioning, physical symptoms and the two-week threshold. We also find out how both sadness and depression leave biological traces, why the confusion delays help, and what coping looks like when it‚Äôs sadness versus treatment when it‚Äôs depression.

title: 22 students hospitalised after consuming mid-day meal at school in Telangana
content: Twenty-two students in Sangareddy, Telangana, were hospitalized after falling ill from mid-day meals, experiencing stomach pain and discomfort. All students are reported to be in stable condition and expected to be discharged soon. This incident follows a similar case in Tamil Nadu where over 33 students fell ill after consuming mid-day meals.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 25,300; Sensex down over 500 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmarks, opened in red on Friday. While Nifty50 went below 25,300, BSE Sensex was down over 500 points.

title: Careers before cradles: Delhi women having children in their 30s
content: Delhi women are increasingly delaying childbirth, with a significant rise in mothers in their 30s. Data reveals a sharp decline in births among younger women, while late 20s now represent the largest birth cohort. Experts attribute this shift to evolving marriage patterns, career aspirations, and improved healthcare access, highlighting personal choices in motherhood.

title: T20 WC row: 'Nahi khelenge'- Former Pakistan captain floats India match boycott plan
content: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif has withdrawn his call for a full T20 World Cup boycott, stating the opportune moment has passed. He now suggests Pakistan could refuse to play India, a decision he insists must come from the government. Latif believes a boycott now would lack impact after Bangladesh's exclusion.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Check recommendations
content: Stock market recommendations: According to Bajaj Broking Research, the top stock picks for January 30, 2026 are State Bank of India (SBI), and Jayaswal Neco Industries. Here‚Äôs its view on Nifty and Bank Nifty:

title: Bangladesh crash out of U19 World Cup; BCB flags 'unfair schedule' by ICC
content: Bangladesh's Under-19 World Cup campaign concluded amidst criticism from their cricket board regarding unfair match scheduling and travel arrangements. The BCB highlighted the team's extensive travel, including a nine-hour bus journey, and accused the ICC of ignoring their concerns about the demanding itinerary.

title: 'Border 2' box office collection day 7
content: The war drama 'Border 2' has achieved a significant milestone, crossing Rs 300 crore worldwide within its first week of release. Despite a strong opening and impressive weekend collections, the film experienced a drop in weekday earnings but continues to maintain its pace at the box office.

title: ‚ÄòHe meant it‚Äô: US warns Iran on nukes, signals Trump has military options ready
content: Secretary of War Pete Hegseth issued a stern warning to Iran against developing nuclear weapons, stating the US is prepared to act under President Trump's directives. He highlighted the ongoing military deployment in the Middle East as a demonstration of readiness and deterrence, emphasizing the administration's commitment to preventing a nuclear Iran.

title: Suicide pact? Greater Noida couple dead; their 3 kids found poisoned, saved in time
content: A couple died and their three children were found poisoned in Greater Noida's Ecotech 3 area. The children, aged 10, 8, and 4, are now out of danger after hospitalisation. Preliminary investigations suggest the couple may have consumed poison due to domestic issues.

title: ‚ÄòMust be corrected‚Äô: Trump threatens Canada with 50% aircraft tariff; dispute over jet certification
content: President Trump has threatened Canada with a 50% tariff on all aircraft sold in the U.S. This retaliatory measure follows Canada's refusal to certify jets from Gulfstream Aerospace. The U.S. also plans to decertify all Canadian aircraft, impacting manufacturers like Bombardier.

title: Gandhi a way of thinking which ideology of hate unsuccessfully tried to erase: Rahul
content: The leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha paid tributes to Mahatma Gandhi, saying that along with Independence, he gave the nation a fundamental principle that the power of truth is greater than the power of authority

content: The operation was carried out on specific intelligence and also involved the P&I (preventive and intelligence) cell of Barabanki

content: The age verification under the DPDP Act will also help online platforms in cutting down access to age inappropriate content or products for children, S. Krishnan said

title: Watch: The Hindu Editorial | On the rapid expansion of State Development Loans
content: Data from States like Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra and West Bengal shows rising dependence on borrowing even as revenue shares remain under pressure. Experts warn that growing debt and reduced fiscal autonomy could strain long-term economic stability.

title: Anti-terror operation intensified in J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar; mobile internet services remain suspended
content: Although the terrorists managed to escape taking advantage of thick vegetation and the challenging terrain, the security forces continued their hunt for the terrorists despite more than two feet of snowfall

title: WHO sees low risk of Nipah virus spreading beyond India
content: The agency does not recommend travel or trade restrictions following reported cases and also stated that it has co-ordinated with Indian health authorities

title: SIT questions actor Jayaram in Sabarimala gold case
content: SIT reportedly questioned Jayaram at his Chennai residence about the number of times he participated in pujas with Unnikrishnan Potti, prime accused in gold misappropriation cases, and whether there were any financial transactions between them

title: Congress top brass meets leaders from Rajasthan,  Chhattisgarh, asks them to work together and flag BJP ‚Äúfailures‚Äù
content: Appointment of booth-level agents, the movement to restore MGNREGA, and alleged irregularities during the final stages of the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls were among the issues discussed

title: SWR to run special train services from Bengaluru to Vijayapura during Shivaratri
content: Train No. 06503 SMVT Bengaluru‚ÄìVijayapura Express Special will depart SMVT Bengaluru at 7.15 pm on February 13, and arrive at Vijayapura at 7.15 am on February 14

title: Meet Divya Surepalli, Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs first licenced civilian woman skydiver
content: The 37-year-old environmental engineer from Visakhapatnam earned her A-licence in 2024 after completing skydiving training abroad

title: Under fire for J&K‚Äôs Republic Day¬†tableau, artist Balwant Thakur says ‚Äòpolitical score-settling unfair‚Äô
content: The artist faced criticism for ‚Äúreflecting¬†foreign Muslim and European influences‚Äù in the tableau which secured the second position nationally

title: Last rites of flight attendant Pinky Mali held in Mumbai
content: Pinky had travelled with Ajit Pawar at least three times in the past few days, says her mournful parents

title: Maharashtra becomes first to launch government-run menopause clinics
content: Government aims to address the issue of hormonal imbalance, bone disorders, sleep disturbances, cardiovascular risks and mental health concerns in women going through menopause

title: IOA president P.T. Usha‚Äôs husband Srinivasan passes away
content: Srinivasan retired as Deputy SP from the CISF and had been actively involved with the Usha School of Athletics, which has produced several international athletes

title: Watch: How will ‚ÄòAjit Dada‚Äôs‚Äô death change the course of Maharashtra‚Äôs political scenario?
content: What will be the decision of the Pawar family, how will Mahayuti be shaped now, what path will the senior satraps of NCP who had accepted Ajit Pawar‚Äôs leadership, take? His death has led to several unanswered questions, leaving a void in the State politics for a long time.

title: U.S. to return three ancient bronze sculptures to India
content: The sculptures are ‚ÄòShiva Nataraja‚Äô, belonging to the Chola period, circa 990; ‚ÄòSomaskanda‚Äô of the Chola period, 12th century; and ‚ÄòSaint Sundarar with Paravai‚Äô of the Vijayanagar period, 16th century

title: Ancient grain storage tradition fading fast in Srikakulam district
content: The ancestral practice known as Khoni or Paathara was once observed by farmers along the banks of the Mahendratanaya River. Several factors‚Äîincluding lack of space and awareness, as well as changes in rural architecture‚Äîhave contributed to its decline. This tradition thrived in the inland, hilly terrain, where underground grain storage was effective. Over time, however, this ancient practice has gradually faded, becoming more of a story from the past, writes T. Appala Naidu.

title: Blaze engulfs forested land at Menamkulam
content: The fire broke out around 1.30 p.m. on the land under the control of the Industries Department, close to vital installations including the Women‚Äôs Battalion and the Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd.‚Äôs LPG filling plant

title: What is the Salman Khan personality rights case? | Explained
content: The ongoing case has generated interest in the legal battle between individual personality rights, particularly in the context of celebrities, and technology companies operating AI-driven platforms in India

title: Baramati plane crash: Probe being conducted on timeline-based approach, says Union Minister
content: Responding to a query about the absence of firefighting personnel during the incident, Union Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu said the airstrip is used primarily by flying training organisations

title: Voters increasingly link their choices with policies, delivery
content: Data show rising women‚Äôs participation and independent decision-making in voting; majority of the voters believe that their vote has a tangible influence

title: Stray dogs at the centre of a growing social divide
content: Villages across Telangana are reporting mass killing of stray dogs with alarming regularity. As fear and frustration mount, stray dog management has turned into a flashpoint, with gram panchayats seeking swift remedies and courts weighing empathy against public safety, writes¬†Swathi Vadlamudi

title: Governor inaugurates 108-foot national flag at Mehdipatnam Garrison
content: The programme included a guard of honour, hoisting of the Tricolour and the rendition of the national anthem

title: Solving Bengaluru‚Äôs parking puzzle
content: While paid parking is being introduced on more stretches and towing is set to make a comeback, Chetan B.C. explores if these measures are enough to solve Bengaluru‚Äôs traffic maze

title: PRIYA trial links teen B12 intake to long-term health in babies
content: Vitamin B12 could be a ‚Äòregulator of regulators‚Äô that controls enzymes involved in gene expression; based on the finding, experts said the national policy should include vitamin B12 supplements to improve the nutritional status of adolescents and women of reproductive age

title: Colleges within schools
content: From just a couple of government colleges in 1966, the year Haryana was formed, the State now has 186. The policy of every school graduate having access to a college within 20 km propelled Haryana into number-driven growth over the past five years. On ground though, Ashok Kumar finds that many colleges are run from school buildings, there are few courses on offer, and an acute shortage of teaching staff leaves students at a disadvantage

title: Guwahati Refinery solely supplied smokeless fuel to Indian Army during Ops Sindoor: Official
content: ‚ÄúThis is a matter of pride that Guwahati Refinery played an important role during the country‚Äôs defence mechanism in Operation Sindoor,‚Äù the Guwahati Refinery (GR) executive director said

title: IAF drops 12,000 litres of water to battle forest fires in Arunachal Pradesh‚Äôs Lohit Valley
content: In an X post, the IAF stated that a dedicated team of Air Warriors was deployed at the urgent request of civic authorities following a plane crash at Baramati Airport

title: NHRC issues notice to Rajasthan government over burial rights demand by Kalbelia community
content: The notice was issued over protests by the Kalbelia community, demanding a designated place for burial of their kin in Barmer district

title: Suvendu Adhikari visits fire affected warehouse, says many are still missing
content: The Leader of Opposition said that when he reached the area, he found that Section 163(2) BNSS was issued, banning the Assembly of five or more persons within a 100-metre radius of the incident site

title: Bihar Cabinet approves additional financial assistance to beneficiaries of Mukhyamantri Mahila Rozgar Yojana
content: In order to streamline and regulate the government employees with regard to the use of social media, the State Cabinet approved the Government Servants‚Äô Conduct (Amendment) Rules, 2026 which will be implemented across the entire state

title: Meghalaya police probe ISIS-linked poster asking tribals to leave
content: The Confederation of Meghalaya Social Organisations petitioned Prime Minister Narendra Modi, calling the threat a serious national security concern

title: Manipur aims to resettle 40,000 IDPs by March
content: The State government has released ‚Çπ124 crore toward rehabilitating 3,700 families to date, an official statement said

title: In Bihar, farmers‚Äô registration work will be carried out from February 2 to 6
content: Goal to Quickly Enter the Second Phase of ‚ÄòAgriStack‚Äô in the Interest of Farmers. Farmers will receive free services at Common Service Centers (CSC); no fees will be charged

title: SIR in Gujarat: 6.88 lakh seek inclusion, 9.88 lakh deletion in electoral rolls
content: Officials said the final decision on additions and deletions will be taken after verification of the applications and supporting documents

title: Jammu and Kashmir CM raises Kashmir shawl seller‚Äôs thrashing issue with Uttarakhand CM; Police lodge FIR, says JKSA
content: The FIR has been registered against Sanjay Yadav and one other individual under Sections 117(2) and 352 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita (BNS)

title: HC questions govt. for not setting up heritage commission
content: High Court orders the publication of a notification in leading dailies, calling for applications for the post of chairman of the commission

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: A statement of fiscal resilience in a volatile federal framework
content: The Budget presented by State Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal serves as a blueprint for navigating global disorder and domestic fiscal challenges. It prioritises revenue-led fiscal consolidation, prudent debt management, inclusive welfare, and innovative investments

title: Heavy security arrangements in Thiruvananthapuram ahead of India-New Zealand T20I match
content: As per the security protocol, the stadium and its surrounding areas have been declared a temporary ‚ÄòRed Zone‚Äô on January 30 and 31

title: Medical college doctors condemn ‚Äòneglect‚Äô in Kerala Budget
content: KGMCTA says while a host of populist measures were announced for all categories of government servants, the doctors were denied even their pay arrears

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: New scheme to provide safe lodging for women employees of IT parks
content: Budget earmarks ‚Çπ950.89 crore for labour and labour welfare sector, an increase of ‚Çπ436.45 crore as compared to last year

title: Prakash Raj pushes for Palestinian films at BIFFes, Siddaramaiah stops short of commitment
content: Speaking in broad strokes, the Chief Minister reiterated that BIFFes aims to provide a platform to understand politics, life, equality and the suffering across countries

title: Karnataka government employees advised to wear khadi on first Saturday of every month
content: Karnataka government employees would be required to purchase khadi garments only from government-run outlets.

title: Religious fervour peaks as Sammakka ceremonially placed on Gadde at shrine, devotee influx set to surge
content: Earlier, following Mulugu Superintendent of Police firing a few rounds into the air, Koya priests, led by Chief Priest Kokkera Krishnaiah, brought down the presiding diety from Chilakalagutta after performing traditional secret rituals in accordance with Koya tribal customs

title: Economic Survey calls for fiscal flexibility for the Centre, cautions States against worsening finances
content: The Economic Survey argued that, while the Centre has managed to substantially improve its fiscal deficit ratios since the COVID-19 pandemic, the States have seen their finances worsen over this period due to falling revenue and higher spending on unconditional cash transfers

title: Minor Kashmiri hawker assaulted in Dehradun
content: The victim sustained multiple injuries, including a fractured arm, in the assault; While his cousin escaped with minor injuries

Then, what is the meaning of running a political party?‚Äù

content: Police officials have stated that further upgrades ‚Äî including multilingual support and integration with government and private agencies ‚Äî are planned to further enhance accessibility and efficiency

content: Rescue teams are scouring the fragile burnt out structure amid mounting fears that the toll will rise

title: Cutting carbon emissions should not be top priority: Economic Survey
content: The Survey in its past iterations has framed climate change as a global risk that threatens food production, livelihoods and has called upon countries - at various times - to ‚Äúsupport‚Äù developing countries such as India to transition away from fossil fuel

title: Kerala Budget 2026-27: ‚Çπ27.82 cr. allocation for environment and habitat sector
content: It includes the allocation of ‚Çπ10.82 crore for the Department of Environment and Climate Change, ‚Çπ13 crore for the Kerala State Biodiversity Board, ‚Çπ3 crore for the Kerala State Pollution Control Board, and ‚Çπ1 crore for the Kerala State Climate Change Adaptation Mission

title: Farmer kills leopard in fight for survival, booked under Wildlife Act
content: The 60-year-old farmer fought off the big cat with a sickle and a spear after it pounced on him and his son in a village in Gujarat; forest officials register case under the Wildlife (Protection) Act, 1972

title: Economic Survey points to decrease in agricultural growth in 2025-26
content: Average annual growth rate over last five years was 4.4% but the second quarter of current financial year saw 3.5% growth, which is less than the average

title: Indian Man Indicted For Smuggling Individuals From Across Canadian Border Into US
content: A 22-year-old citizen of India has been indicted here for his role in a scheme to smuggle Indian nationals from Canada across the northern border into the United States.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Power Within Power: How A Unique Web Of Bodies Complicates Trump's Iran Plans
content: Trump's dreams of effecting a regime change in Iran need to be considered along two factors related to the power structures within Iran, both of which US seems indifferent to.

title: "No Proof To Refute": Vinod Khosla After Musk's "Pompous A**hole" Remark
content: Indian-origin billionaire investor Vinod Khosla has criticised Elon Musk again for "seemingly racist" statements and involving his family to defend himself.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX Said To Consider Merger With Tesla Or xAI
content: SpaceX is considering a potential merger with Tesla Inc, as well as an alternative combination with artificial intelligence firm xAI, according to people familiar with the matter, a sign billionaire Elon Musk is weighing how to consolidate his empire

title: FBI Imposter Tries To Get Luigi Mangione Out Of Jail With Pizza Cutter
content: Mark Anderson, a 36-year-old Minnesota native who has a history of drug and other arrests and disclosed last year in court papers that he suffers from mental illness, was arrested.

title: Microsoft Inks $750 Million Cloud Deal With AI Firm Perplexity
content: AI startup Perplexity signed a $750 million deal with Microsoft Corp. to use its Azure cloud service, spreading its business beyond longtime cloud partner Amazon.com Inc.

title: Union Budget 2026: How Budget Shapes Stock Market Moves
content: This year, the stock markets will remain open on Budget day, February 1, even though it falls on a Sunday.

title: Amazon In Talks To Invest $50 Billion In OpenAI, Expand Ties
content: Amazon.com Inc. is in talks to invest as much as $50 billion in OpenAI and expand an agreement that involves selling computer power to the AI startup, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: ICE Begins Buying 'Mega' Warehouse Detention Centres Across US
content: Despite protests in small towns and cities across the US, the Trump administration is pushing ahead with the purchase of warehouses it plans to convert into immigration jails in what could be the largest expansion of such detention capacity in US.

title: BJP Calls Siddaramaiah, DK Shivakumar "Scam Lord" On X, Complaint Filed
content: The complaint has been filed by the Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee (KPCC) at the Cyber Crime police station.

title: Trump Sues US Revenue Service, Treasury For $10 Billion Over Tax-Return Leak
content: President Donald Trump sued the US Treasury and Internal Revenue Service for at least $10 billion over an unauthorized disclosure of his tax returns to the press during his first term in office.

title: MLA's Brother Fined For Riding Without Helmet, Clashes With Cops
content: A routine vehicle-checking drive turned into a high-voltage confrontation in Madhya Pradesh after the brother of a BJP MLA allegedly threatened and argued with on-duty policemen, triggering a fight that was caught on camera and has gone viral.

title: Google DeepMind's Project Genie Lets You Walk, Fly, Drive Through Imagination
content: Project Genie uses Genie 3, a smart AI that can build interactive worlds from simple text or pictures.¬†

title: A March 31 Deadline For Bengal To Hand Over Land For Border Fencing
content: The Calcutta High Court has set a March 31 deadline for the West Bengal government to hand over already acquired land for fencing along the Indo-Bangladesh border.

title: Set Of Nizam's Jewels Under High-Security Custodial Arrangement With RBI: Centre
content: A set of Nizam's jewels is under a "high-security custodial arrangement" with the Reserve Bank of India, and the Ministry of Culture recognises its historical, cultural and heritage significance, the government has informed Rajya Sabha.

title: Rupee Recovers From Lowest Level, Gains 9 Paise To 91.90 Against US Dollar
content: The rupee recovered from its lowest level and gained 9 paise to trade at 91.90 against the American currency in early deals on Friday, supported by lower crude oil prices in the international market.

title: Dense Fog, Fluctuating Weather Grip Delhi As Air Quality Remains A Concern
content: Residents of Delhi woke up to a foggy Friday morning as dense mist, cloudy skies, and declining air quality continued to affect the national capital.

title: Opinion: Opinion | No India, No Quad: What America's New Defence Strategy Report Really Means
content: The absence of any mention of India and the Quad from the strategy is not a judgment on their importance, but a signal that the United States does not intend to organise Asian security through formalised coalitions or extended military guarantees.

title: US Releases List Of Gifts From Indian Leaders To American Counterparts
content: The US State Department has released a compilation of gifts presented by Prime Minister Narendra Modi as well as other Indian government officials to US leaders, including former President Joe Biden.

title: Ajit Pawar Wanted To Reunite NCP Factions As 'Gift' To Uncle: NCP Leader
content: According to the NCP leader, Ajit Pawar had urged him and other senior leaders including Vitthal Sheth Maniar and Srinivas Patil - who share a close bond with the senior Pawar - to facilitate a reconciliation.

title: Smells like separatism: Oil-rich Alberta slipping from Canada to America?
content: a growing separatist movement in the country‚Äôs oil-rich province of Alberta has ignited a full-blown diplomatic spat with Washington . leaders of the Alberta Prosperity Project (APP) have held a series of high-level meetings with officials in Washington to discuss breaking away from Canada . APP representatives are reported to have met US State Department officials at least three times in recent months .

title: Blakeney goes from an NBA player to alleged game fixer
content: federal law enforcement unsealed criminal charges alleging Blakeney was one of the ringleaders in a u.s. college basketball gambling and game-fixing scandal involving 26 defendants . the indictment alleges Blakeney convinced NCAA players that his other co-conspirators would pay $10,000 to $32,000 in exchange for poor performances, sitting out of or removing themselves from games, and providing information about players' health .

title: Sources: Cunningham set to become Falcons' GM
content: the Atlanta Falcons hired former assistant general manager Ian Cunningham as their new GM . the 40-year-old joins president of football Matt Ryan and coach Kevin Stefanski . "his vision for our team aligned exactly with the type of leader we were seeking to help take the Falcons to the next level," Ryan says .

title: Eagles hire Packers QB coach Mannion as OC
content: the Eagles are hiring Sean Mannion as their offensive coordinator . the 33-year-old has coached for just two years, breaking in as an offensive assistant for the Green Bay Packers in 2024 . he was promoted to quarterbacks coach this past season .

title: The Premier League stars who could still move this...
